verbs.description: wolve (third-person singular simple present wolves, present participle wolving, simple past and past participle wolved)

entries.meaning: Of an organ, to make a hollow whining sound like that of a wolf.
examples: he had returned to his schoolboy's script, to distant Evensongs, to the wolving of the ancient chapel organ as the last light is extinguished and the door latched for the long night.
